characters: EXT. THE GATE TO PEKING. DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security men and porters are loading wagons for a convoy. As they work, we see across the lake a lone horseman ente the village.  One of the men recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Li is here! ANGLE ON: Li Mu Bai, thirties, powerful and handsome. In the background, old Aunt Wu, at the sight of Li Mu Bai drops her parcels and runs excitedly into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Wu runs hurriedly through the halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu Lien!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu, a beautiful woman in her early 30s, is finishing pack for the convoy, wrapping a few small items in a linen wrapper, as Aunt Wu bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li Mu Bai is here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Please come in. Yu sits, composed, as Aunt Wu ushers Li in.  Li carries a large object, wrapped in silk. Yu smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mu Bai...It's been too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has. (he glances around the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  And how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. An awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monk Zheng said you were at Wudan Mountain.  He said you were practicing deep meditation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mountain must be so peaceful... I envy you.  My work keeps me so busy, I hardly get any rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left the training early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  You're a Wudan fighter. Training is everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During my meditation training... I came to a place of deep silence... I was surrounded by light... Time and space disappeared.  I had come to a place my master had never told me about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were enlightened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I didn't feel the bliss of enlightenment.  Instead... I was surrounded by an endless sorrow.  I couldn't bear it.  I broke off my meditation.  I couldn't go on. There was something... pulling me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I can't let go of.  You are leaving soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're preparing a convoy for a delivery to Peking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I could ask you to deliver something to Sir Te for me. Li unwraps the object.  It is an ancient, astonishingly beautiful sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Green Destiny Sword?  You're giving it to Sir Te?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  He has always been our greatest protector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  How can you part with it?  It has always been with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many men have died at its edge. It only looks pure because blood washes so easily from its blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You use it justly, you're worthy of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for me to leave it behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what will you do now? Li doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me to Peking.  You can give the sword to Sir Te yourself. It'll be just like old times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I must visit my master's grave.  It's been many years since Jade Fox murdered him.  I have yet to avenge his death.  And yet I'm thinking of quitting.  I must pray for his forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join me once you have finished.  I can wait for you in Peking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE GATE TO PEKING. DAY
dialogues.text: Customs officials have just finished checking the content in a row of carriages bearing the Sun Security insignia. The caravan slowly passes through the checkpoint into the boundaries of Peking.  Yu, riding a handsome horse and clearly the leader, watches as her crew clears inspection

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.  Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Let's go into the city.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OUTSIDE A DEPOT. DAY
dialogues.text: Workers are busy unloading the contents from the carriage Boss Giao is checking off the merchandise -- a cargo of medicinal herbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything got here safely.  I'm much obliged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun Security has been the best since your father started it. You're a credit to his memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a gray tiled roof, we can see Peking's magnificent g of houses extending miles and miles out, freshly painted the morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PEKING STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: Dusty and congested as always, people, horses, and carria are fighting to get through the boulevards. A group of jugglers perform at a corner. Yu surveys the busy street from on top of her horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu presents the sword to Sir Te.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Li's personal sword, a great hero's weapon!  He is the only one in the world worthy of carrying it.  It's too fine a gift. I cannot accept it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te!  It has brought him as much trouble as glory.  Help him to leave these troubles behind. Otherwise, he'll never be able to start anew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I'll act as the sword's custodian. De Lu, the head servant, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governor Yu has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've always been so good to Li Mu Bai and me.  Please accept our thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do not be such a stranger. You'll stay the night as my guest. Now, Shu Lien... tell me something. And forgive me for prying.  Your father was a great friend to me, and I think of you as my own daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Sir Te, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li Mu Bai giving up his sword and his warrior days... maybe he's trying to tell you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be coy.  I've always known about your feelings for each other. All these years, it's a shame... neither of you is brave enough to admit the truth to the other. You're both wasting precious time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon.  Li Mu Bai and I aren't cowards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it comes to emotions, even great heroes can be idiots.  Tell me if Li Mu Bai is not more open the next time you see him.  I'll give him an earful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu and De Lu approach the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te said to leave the sword in here. De Lu opens the door and is startled to find a young woma inside.  The woman is studying the sheets of calligraphy hanging on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your guest today.  I am Governor Yu's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sir Te's study.  You are here to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for a quiet corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Sir Te's head servant.  And this is another of our guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu gently lays the sword, still in its sheath, in Jen's h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's heavy for such a thin piece of metal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The handle is heavy.  And the blade is no ordinary metal.  Still, the sword is the lightest of weapons. You're just not used to handling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have had much practice.  As a child in the West, a platoon lived with us.  They'd let me play with their weapons.  The scabbard is so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful but dangerous.  Once you see it tainted with blood, its beauty is hard to admire.  It's 400 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exquisite!  You said it belongs to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend Li Mu Bai.  He's given it to Sir Te as a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li Mu Bai!  The famous warrior? Why would he give his sword to Sir Te?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too young to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sword fighter too? Yu yanks the sword out of the sheath.  An eerie sound resonates within the study.  Jen is even more impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.  But I prefer the machete.  Certain moves, however, call for a sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Yu puts the sword back in the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (longingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be exciting to be a fighter, to be totally free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighters have rules too: friendship, trust, integrity... Without rules, we wouldn't survive for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read all about people like you. Roaming wild, beating up anyone who gets in your way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writers wouldn't sell many books if they told how it really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're just like the characters in the stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  No place to bathe for days, sleeping in flea-infested beds... They tell you all about that in those books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.  I'm getting married soon, but I haven't lived the life I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I heard.  Congratulations.  It's the most important step in a woman's life, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not married, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You couldn't roam around freely if you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably right. Yu studies Jen.  The room falls silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dusk and the sky is beautiful orange and purple.  Je is leaving the study escorted by her maid.  She turns to for a final good-bye.  Yu seems intrigued by the encounte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two lighted lanterns are raised up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te hands the sword to Governor Yu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Governor Yu. Governor Yu is impressed by the opulence and elegance of sword.  He closes his eyes to guess the weight of the swo Te snubs out the flame from a candle, then slides the swo out from its sheath.  The sword gives off a luminous blue glow in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two feet 9 inches long.  1 inch wide.  The handle is 1 inch deep, 2.6 inches wide.  Seven-tenths of an inch thick.  With seven rubies missing from the hilt.  You can tell the design dates back to before the Chin era.  Engraved with a technique lost by the time of the Han Dynasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your knowledge is remarkable, Sir Te.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sword by itself rules nothing. It comes alive only through skillful manipulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see your point.  Please continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Imperial Court isn't the problem.  With royalty and officials everywhere, the Royal Guard keeps security tight.  But Peking is not like the West.  Here, you'll find all sorts of characters.  Proceed with caution in your quest for law and order.  Don't depend only on the court.  Contacts in the Giang Hu underworld can ensure your position.  Be strong, yet supple. This is the way to rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A maid warms her hands in a basin of hot water for Jen, t walks over to Jen and helps remove her earrings.  Someone knocks and the maid goes to answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do it. The maid leaves as the governess enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made you silk pajamas.  Do you want to change into them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you met Shu Lien today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's one of those.  Your mother would not want you consorting with her kind. Jen shoots her an angry look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll socialize with whomever I please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't invite danger into your father's house. She's about to say something, then thinks better of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed then.  Miss has grown up, and is getting married soon.  God knows what the future will bring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be just the same.  Enough! I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autumn is coming.  I'll shut the windows for you. The governess leaves.  Jen sits on the side of her bed, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide shot of the compound.  A patrol man greets Master Sir Te's head of security.  The place is serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chilly, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Master Bo. As Bo walks on, shadows rustle in a treetop in the backgr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A masked figure silently opens the window and enters the room.  It moves swiftly to the sword case, opens it, and wraps the sword. Bo enters, sees the thief, who leaps up to the ceiling. thief steps over Bo and out into the courtyard.  Bo tries stop the thief, who easily outwits him, jumping onto the roof as Bo yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone help!  Stop him!  He's on the roof!  The sword's been stolen! Stop thief!  Stop him! The thief skips a few times and jumps off to a side stree Bo grabs a pole and runs, as gongs begin to sound, alerti people to the theft.  People rush outside, Yu Shu Lien am them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo runs through the streets.  The thief is nowhere in sig Suddenly, there are sounds of weapons clashing.  Bo hurri towards the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo is surprised to see the hooded figure battling with tw other fighters -- Tsai (male, 40s) and May, his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jade Fox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must avenge mother! The hooded figure does a gravity defying flip and soars o a wall, just as Bo arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something!  He's getting away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thief runs atop a roof -- right into Yu.  Yu and the hooded figure face off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return the sword, and I'll let you go. The figure just regards her, slightly shifting weight. Yu attacks, but the figure repels her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been trained at Wudan? The figure answers by leaping to another rooftop.  Yu catches up, and resumes her attack with a relentless seri of lightning-quick blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo follows Tsai and May, who are quickly walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mistaken.  We're just street performers.  We were rehearsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were rehearsing?  Who are you trying to fool? May wants to respond but is again cut off by Tsai.  They off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did that thief go? Bo looks around and discovers he had chased the thief int Governor Yu's compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governor Yu's house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu and the Black Figure continue to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down here!  Give back the sword!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu slowly gets the upper hand in her fight with the thief A small arrow cuts across the night and flies toward Yu. She catches it, but the masked figure takes the opportuni to get away. Yu pauses to feel the arrow in her hand, standing in the empty courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De Lu escorts Yu into Te's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te awaits you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men are standing at attention.  Bo is giving his account what happened, as Yu enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure the thief is in the Yu household.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you imply?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Enough. The men hustle out.  Bo can barely contain his frustratio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Governor Yu ever seen the sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, though I doubt he's involved in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the sword could be in his compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then someone's trying to set him up. We should inform Li Mu Bai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Yu is returning from temple.  The governess is help her out of the carriage.  Servants are peeling bills off wall across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Yu, someone's put up posters. A partially torn flyer with the words "Jade Fox will not escape justice!" is seen on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is after Jade Fox. Preposterous, looking for her here! Madam Yu nods and walks inside, as the Governess tosses t flyer away and follows her. A hand scoops up the flyer -- it is Yu.  She studies it, then puts it in her pocket, and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo is searching for the Tsais.  The bridge is full of jugglers.  But the two are nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo quizzes a homeless man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I haven't seen them in two days. Bo is about to give up when he looks up and sees May walk quickly into an alley.  Bo follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May walks into a dilapidated house surrounded by a broken down bamboo fence.  Bo inches closer and sees May and Tsa oiling their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen practices calligraphy.  The governess is by her side embroidering and throwing occasional glances at Jen.  The maid enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a Miss Shu Lien here to see you. Jen stops and looks up at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss is busy right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show her in. The governess shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This spells trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a guest. The governess gets up to leave just as the maid shows Yu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way please. The governess and Yu exchange quick glances.  The governe bows slightly and departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bored. Yu sees the calligraphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing calligraphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll write your name.  Just for fun. Jen writes Yu's name with great confidence and swiftness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never realized my name looks like "sword." Jen freezes slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You write gracefully.  Calligraphy is so similar to fencing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it is.  I wouldn't know. The maid enters with tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for seeing me.  I hear your wedding day is near.  You must be overwhelmed by the preparations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hardly doing a thing.  The less I think of it the better.  My parents are arranging everything. The Gous are a very powerful family. My marrying one will be good for my father's career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are fornuate to marry into such a noble family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?  I wish I were like the heroes in the books I read.  Like you and Li Mu Bai.  I guess I'm happy to be marrying.  But to be free to live my own life, to choose whom I love... That is true happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think so?  Let me tell you a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About you and Li Mu Bai?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Did you know I was once engaged to be married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name was Meng Si Zhao.  He was a brother to Li Mu Bai by oath. One day, while in battle, he was killed by the sword of Li Mu Bai's enemy.  After, Li Mu Bai and I went through a lot together.  Our feelings for each other grew stronger.  But how could we dishonor Meng's memory?  So the freedom you talk about, I too desire it.  But I have never tasted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad for Meng, but it's not your fault, or Li Mu Bai's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not an aristocrat, as you are... but I must still respect a woman's duties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't distance us.  From now on, let's be like sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as a sister, let me wish you happiness in your marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maid escorts Yu out.  Yu pauses, looks around, and se the profile of the Governess peering at her from around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight spills into the room, as Jen rises sleeplessly from bed and looks out the window.  A light breeze stirs hair.  The sound of the wind rises, and slowly her face dissolves, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the face of a younger, less sophisticated Jen, as she lets the dry desert air flow through her hair.  She sits a carriage, part of a caravan, with guards on horseback, that is traveling through the spectacular desert.  Across from her sits her mother, of whom she is barely cognizant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a godforsaken place!  Can't your father be appointed closer to civilization?  Jen... are you listening to me? Jen is still looking out the side of the carriage, at a beautiful mountainside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen sighs, and turns back toward her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsai and May have been sitting, hidden in the branches of tree, watching Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! They drop down silently and walk away.  From another roof Lo looks silently on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsai and May enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the tiny house, they discover a hooded figure goin through their belongings. Immediately Tsai throws a knife, which rips off the figur mask -- revealing Bo.  Tsai has another long knife at his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  I'm a friend! Tsai pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May fans a small coal-fired grill that is boiling a sizzl pot of vegetable and meatball soup.  Her father and Bo ar now friendly dinner companions, much to May's delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about your sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you spying on the Yus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for someone.  Jade Fox. I'm a police inspector from Shaan Xi, Gen Su district.  Jade Fox is a master criminal.  I hear she infiltrated the Yus.  She must have come with them when they transferred here.  But with Yu's reputation, I can't just go in and accuse her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Jade Fox is a woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then leave her to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, but I doubt you can handle her.  My wife was quite a martial arts expert.  Jade Fox killed her.  So you see, this is personal.  Leave her to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ready! (re: the soup)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready for anything! Bo fishes into the pot with his chopsticks.  May intercep him with her own chopsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father gets first dip. Tsai stiffens and snaps his chopsticks, not to pick up a meatball but to catch an incoming dart.  A dart wrapped w a note.  Bo jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We'll settle this at midnight on Yellow Hill."  Good, the fox is out of her hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu is ushered into the room, to discover Sir Te talking t another man, whose back is to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu Lien, look who's here. The man turns around -- it's Li Mu Bai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu and Li Mu Bai sit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te believes it's a ploy cast suspicion on Governor Yu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But something is going on at the Yu household.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you discovered? From her sleeve, Yu removes the flyer.  Li takes it, his face darkening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jade Fox?  Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always suspected she'd fled to the West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think she'd dare come back to Peking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any place safer than under the nose of Governor Yu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I shall avenge my master's death after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.  Sir Te requires discretion.  Official business is difficult enough.  Don't let personal feelings make it worse. And I don't know... even this poster... could be some sort of trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see who posted it? Yu pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says Jade Fox is hiding at Yu's. On the night of the theft there was a brawl near Yu's.  Were you involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Bo, Sir Te's man.  I hear he followed the thief to the Yus'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you questioned him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your men are watching over Yu's compund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'd already sent them home. You can blame me for losing the sword, but please trust that I'll get it back soon using my own methods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant.  I don't care about the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  Didn't you come back here for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know it was stolen until I got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, why did you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we had talked... De Lu enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon my intrusion.  Master Li, your room is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  Please lead the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsai, Bo, and May wait under an ancient tree.  Bo stifles yawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fox doesn't care much for punctuality.  Still no sign of her. An old lady struggles up the hill, wearing a floppy hat o her face, holding a cane.  The three exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!  Show yourself. The old woman shrinks in fear, but then throws off her disguise and unveils herself -- the Governess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsai... you dog!  You will pay for your stubbornness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you think, old witch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you surrender now, you'll suffer less.  But if you resist, I won't stop until you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!  Let me avenge my mother's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll soon end up like her, you little whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll pay for that! A fierce battle begins, the main fighting between Tsai an Fox, with May and Bo getting a stab in occasionally, when the opportunity presents itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to paralyze you! Using acupressure, Fox disables Bo.  May shoots an arrow her, but she catches it and flings it back, hitting May.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May! Fox then disables Tsai, but just as she goes for the kill Li Mu Bai flies down from the treetops and steps between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsai, you filthy mongrel!  An ambush!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, are you all right? Li addresses Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wudan should have gotten rid of you long ago.  It's been a long time, Jade Fox!  You don't remember me... But you should remember my master. You infiltrated Wudan while I was away.  You stole our master!  Now it's time for you to pay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your master underestimated us women. Sure, he'd sleep with me, but he would never teach me.  He deserved to die by a woman's hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole the secrets of Wudan's highest martial arts.  But after ten years of training, your moves are still undisciplined.  And today, under a Wudan sword... you will die! Li easily brings Fox to the ground. Li raises his sword to the prostrate Fox.  A figure maske in black appears next to Fox, sword extended, saving her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disciple, we'll kill them all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must get rid of Tsai! Fox fights Tsai, Bo, and May, as Li addresses the masked figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?  Why is the Green Destiny in your possession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Li Mu Bai.  The Green Destiny is mine.  Jade Fox can't be your master.  Where did you learn that "Xuan Piu" move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just playing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, who is your master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must kill them! Tsai throws his blade at Fox, who catches it and throws i back, hitting him in the head.  Fox and the masked figure leap away. May drops to the ground, cradling her dead father's head. Bo kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Te and a group of his men look down as a cloth is removed from over the body of Tsai.  Bo and May stand before them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Tsai?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father.  Police Inspector from Shaan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should be reported to Governor Yu.  The victim is an officer.  You believe the killer is hiding out in his compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd bet my life on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Li and Yu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. He exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Te, Li, and Yu are seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This needs to be resolved, and quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get into the Yu household and get her.  I'll ferret out Fox and her gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be careful.  Governor Yu is a court official, and in charge of security.  Any disturbance will cast suspicion on him.  It might get Sir Te in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a delicate matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te, can you find some excuse to invite Madam Yu and her daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best way to trap a fox is through her cubs. Sir Te and Li look puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu sits with Madam Yu and Jen.  They busy themselves with various items for her trousseau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Te is certainly spoiling us with these wedding gifts.  She's being so considerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry she's not feeling well enough to receive you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard Sir Te lost something.  And now Madame Te's not feeling well... Jen sits silently reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know who stole the missing item. If the thief returns it, I'm sure Sir Te will pursue the matter no further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.  Sometimes the help can't keep their hands to themselves. It's very embarassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te knows that even well-meaning people can make mistakes... that can bring ruin to themselves and their families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't be too lenient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mercy will be shown toward the murderer who turned up in Peking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murderer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  The very killer of Li Mu Bai's own master.  Last night, she killed a policeman who had tracked her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female criminal!  Now that's news! Jen becomes visibly upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say she killed a policeman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, from the West.  He went undercover and and followed her here,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the murderer and the thief are one and the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.  This thief... it very unusual... As Yu speaks, she lifts the tea pot to pour Jen some tea. As she finishes speaking, she looks into Jen's face and t pot slips from her hand.  Without even looking down, Jen instinctively catches the pot with a lightning-fast move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And most likely smarter than a mere killer. Sir Te and Li Mu Bai walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (formal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings, Sir Te.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Madam Yu.  This is Li Mu Bai, the renowned swordsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delighted to meet you. Li sizes Jen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Yu is soon to be married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May opens her door, only to find Bo standing guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.  It's cold. She turns back inside, hesitates, then turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.  We don't have to fear Jade Fox if we're together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A still, dark night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something moves in the moonlight.  A hooded figure jumps Li Mu Bai, who had been hiding in the shadows, comes forw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a bit too late to be out? You've brought me the sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do as I please. The masked figure lunges away, but Li Mu Bai leaps with incredible speed and grabs the sword from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you? The figure floats away.  Li chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two fly over houses and bounce off of rooftops, displaying amazing floating skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure bounces into an old monastery.  Li is already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had enough flying?  You've got potential.  You've studied the Wudan Manual but you don't understand it.  You need a real master. The figure doesn't respond, but we sense the pride in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you are a real master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like most things, I am nothing. It's the same for this sword.  All of it is simply a state of mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking like a monk!  Just fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me where Jade Fox is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On guard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real sharpness comes without effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure leaps into the garden, but again, Li is ahead her. The figure attacks Li, who uses his agility to evade her. Frustrated, the figure intensifies her attack. The figure, losing composure, attacks wildly.  Li gets ev more elusive, using a branch to repel her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No growth without assistant.  No action without reaction.  No desire without restraint.  Now give yourself up and find yourself again. There is a lesson for you. Li now holds the stick to her mask, gently raising it slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I?  You need practice. I can teach you to fight with the Green Destiny, but first you must learn to hold it in stillness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to teach me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted a disciple worthy of Wudan's secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I use them to kill you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a risk I'm willing to take. Deep down, you're good.  Even Jade Fox couldn't corrupt you. The figure's eyes cloud with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wudan is a whorehouse!  Keep your lessons! The figure swirls and takes off, leaving a rueful Li stan alone in the monastery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen slips in through the window.  She pulls off her mask, she spots the Governess/Fox sitting and sewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're home late... or should I say early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you still here?  You killed a policeman.  You should leave! You'll bring ruin on my whole family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't have found me if you hadn't stolen the sword.  Like a little girl, you thought stealing would be fun?  You, too, are responsible for that death.  Come with me.  You don't want to waste your life as the wife of some bureaucrat.  Denied your talent... As a master and disciple we will rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never live as a thief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already a thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was just for fun.  How can I leave?  Where would I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever we want.  We'll get rid of anyone in our way.  Even your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Giang Hu fighter lifestyle... kill or be killed. Exciting, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do!  You are still my disciple. Jen lunges at the Governess, and the two exchange a few blows.  Jen presses her finger against one of the Governe pressure points, disabling her.  Jen pushes her across th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you've been teaching me all these years from the manual? You couldn't even decipher the symbols!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I studied the diagrams.  But you hid the details!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have understood, even if I had tried to explain.  You know... you've gone as far as you can go.  I hid my skills so as not to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hadn't seen you fight with Li Mu Bai, I'd still be ignorant of all you've hidden from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master... I started learning from you in secret when I was 10.  You enchanted me with the world of Giang Hu.  But once I realized I could surpass you, I became so frightened!  Everything fell apart. I had no one to guide me, no one to learn from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I've a lesson or two left to teach you! Fox exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Governess leaves, a small sack over her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li practices fluently with Green Destiny in hand, beautif at ease with the weapon.  He spins around to find Yu stan in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sword is back... are you happy? Li smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit, getting it back makes me realize how much I'd missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not your sword anymore. You gave it to Sir Te.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.  But I must borrow it for one last mission.  Jade Fox must die at its edge.  Did you know what you were hiding when you covered for that girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job was to get the sword back, without embarassing anyone.  I wasn't about to ruin her life, or her father's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did your job well.  But, this girl... I saw her last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew she would intrigue you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs direction... and training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an aristocrat's daughter. She's not one of us.  In any case, it will all be over soon.  You'll kill Fox, and she'll marry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not for her.  She should come to Wudan and become a disciple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Wudan does not accept women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For her, they might make an exception.  If not, I'm afraid she'll become a poisoned dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not our affair.  Even if Wudan accepts her, her husband might object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought by giving away the sword, I could escape the Giang Hu world. But the cycle of bloodshed continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish there were something more I could do to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be patient with me, Shu Lien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen is asleep.  A noise awakens her. Lo opens the window and sneaks in -- right into the point Jen's waiting sword. Jen's sword drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen! Lo grabs her by the wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the traffic on your rooftop these days... it took me a while to get in here.  I can't wait any longer.  I was wrong to let you go.  Come back with me.  You'll be happy in the desert.  You'll be free there. Jen turns back to him and rests herself briefly in his ar again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been looking for me all this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen holds up a comb, with daylight shining through it.  J admires the piece, her most prized possession. Madam Yu sits opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen... stop playing with it. Jen looks out over the desert, as the wind picks up and t sky darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't break it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and a group of armed bandits descend on the caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dark Cloud!  Dark Cloud is coming! His warning is useless.  From Jen's pov, we see the guard slaughtered in a hail of arrows and swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower the shade, don't let them see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch the women! Though unharmed, Madam Yu immediately faints.  Lo approac the carriage and grabs the comb from Jen's hand. She bolts from the carriage, and, once outside, bends dow and grabs a lance from the body of a dead guard, whose ho flails beside him. She looks up to see the gang of bandits already making th escape on horseback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen and Lo ride across the desert floor at breakneck spee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come get your comb. She tries to jab him with the lance, but he grabs it and flings her off her horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry back to your mother. Lo rides on as she charges after her horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of bandits is dividing up the loot, as Jen rides keeping a respectable distance.  They notice her and rise she dismounts. One of them saunters over to her and stands, grinning, a feet away. In a second, she's slammed his balls into his stomach and knocked his nose into his face.  He crumples to the sand. The other bandits stop laughing, quickly exchange glances and charge her at once. In a matter of seconds, they're either on the ground or dragging their fallen comrades back. Lo calls out and stops the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and Jen ride, if not side-by-side, then parallel, abou 20 feet apart.  Their pace has slowed considerably.  In fact, they're dead tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's stop a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting a bit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tired.  You need rest.  Your horse needs water.  There's a creek up here. He dismounts, looks down at the dry creek bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there used to be!  What's your name?  I'm Lo.  The Hans call me Dark Cloud.  I'm not that tall or big, but I'm quick as lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My comb! She kicks him.  They fight ferociously until Lo, exhauste collapses.  She kicks him a few times, then collapses too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen comes to and finds herself wrapped in a blanket of animal fur.  She sits up with a start and checks her clot Looking around, she realizes she's in a cave.  Next to he are a lamp, some hunting equipment, and a neat row of sha arrows.  She quickly grabs one of the arrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you like that arrow, I can make you a bow.  Great for hunting wild chicken.  They're delicious. Jen raises one of the arrows, going on the attack again, her legs betray her and she falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to eat, understand?  Then you'll have the strength to fight. Understand? He helps her up, then pours her some horse milk from a sa He hands her a small chunk of food, which she first accep grudgingly, then, her hunger getting the better of her, s starts to wolf it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're eating too fast.  Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo walks out into a barren mountain landscape.  A chicken roasts over a fire.  Lo whistles. Jen appears suddenly with a rock and knocks it over his h Lo passes out as Jen scurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen tries to find her way among the treacherous stony terrain, her lips chapped and fingers bloody and blistere But soon she passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen again awakes inside the cave.  Lo tries to feed her s water, but she chokes, and tries to push him away, only t find that her legs and hands are tied up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got quite a temper.  It's better this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in a bad mood?  At least you're speaking.  What's your name? Jen spits at Lo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think the Hans had names like that. Later: She weaves in and out of consciousness.  In the flickering lights, she sees Lo sharpening his arrows. Later, he pulls back an opaque curtain to reveal a makesh bathroom -- a water-filled cavity serves as a tub. He rises as Jen sobs at the sight of her imprisoned and dishevelled body.  He comes over and unties her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  If I had wanted to, I would already have done it.  You must be dying for a bath.  Fresh water's hard to get here.  But I managed to bring some up.  You can wear my clothes when you're done.  They're clean.  Don't worry.  I'll sing, so you'll know where I am.  After the bath, you'll be calmer. Jen nods and the bandit releases her.  He starts to sing he walks out.  Jen waits until the sound recedes before closing the curtain behind her and dipping into the pit. While she bathes, she listens to his singing, a loud rendition of a tribal song.  Lo apparently doesn't rememb all the lyrics, and la-las his way through more than a fe passages.  Jen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen grimaces as Lo pulls the last of some cactus needles from the soles of her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more hitting on the head!  All this trouble for a comb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine.  It means a lot to me. A barbarian like you wouldn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not true.  I can use it to pick fleas from my horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I'm a real Manchurian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I guessed wrong.  I though you were a Han.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me back my comb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't take orders from anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it back. Jen impulsively grabs an arrow and stabs Lo, drawing a little blood from his chest.  Furious, Lo lunges at her a they tussle briefly.  Finally, Lo gets on top of Jen, and the scuffling becomes more like foreplay.  Violence turns into unleashed passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and Jen ride across the desert.  Jen holds tightly to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and Jen lie in the bath together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a boy, one night, I saw a thousand shooting stars.  I thought, where did they all go? I'm an orphan.  I used to look for stars alone.  I thought if I rode to the other end of the desert, I'd find them.  I've been riding in the desert ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, the little boy became a fearsome bandit.  He couldn't find the stars, so he stole my comb. Lo pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out here, you always fight for survival.  You have to be part of a gang to stand a chance.  Slowly, your gang becomes your family.  All that Dark Cloud stuff is just to scare people and make my life easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're still that little boy looking for shooting stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a man.  And now I've found the brightest star of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo sees uniformed men through his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's men are looking for you. Jen doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and Jen ride through a mountain pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and Jen stand at the crest of a cliff.  Lo looks over, viewing the desert valley below, as Jen joins him.  They a troop of uniformed men riding by in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's men are still looking for you.  They're still out there, circling closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is trouble for me. Jen bites her lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't send me back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must decide.  You might get tired of this life.  You might begin to miss your family.  If it were our daughter, we'd look for her too.  She would miss us.  Jen... I want you to be mine forever.  I will make my mark on the world.  I will earn your parents' respect. We have a legend.  Anyone who dares to jump from the mountain, God will grant his wish.  Long ago, a young man's parents were ill, so he jumped.  He didn't die.  He wasn't even hurt.  He floated away, far away, never to return.  He knew his wish had come true.  If you believe, it will happen.  The elders say, "A faithful heart makes wishes come true."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen and Lo kiss.  Jen takes the jade comb out of her hair and presses it into his palm.  Jen starts to cry.  They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it safe.  Return it to me when we are together again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling painfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't, I'll come after you. And I won't let you off so easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen quietly walks out and stands sadly in the early morni light. End of flashback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever I went, someone always recognized me.  I really tried. Later, I heard you came to Peking. I was afraid I'd never see you again.  So I came.  I can't let you marry. Jen is about to respond when a servant's voice is heard f outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever come back. Lo hovers at the window frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's over? Jen pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Lo thrusts a small object in her hand. He lifts his legs through the window, and drops out of sight, just as Jen's door is opened from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard noises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a cat. The maid pauses, then dutifully exits, closing the door. Jen opens up her palm; gasping, she sees the comb that Lo has given her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise and color of a wedding procession.  A marching band heralds the occasion, as throngs of onlookers fight get a glimpse of the groom, Gou Jun Pei, who trots by on handsome white horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen's head is completely covered in red cloth, as she rid silently in the bride's carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li and Yu watch the festivities from a balcony of the cit gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Jade Fox will show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out there, but I doubt she'll show herself.  We'll keep our eyes open.  Sooner or later, she'll come for the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small arrow flies into the carriage.  Jen calmly lifts red cloth from her face and pulls the arrow out of the panelling inside the carriage. We hear Lo's voice from outside the carriage, but Jen doesn't seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen!  Come with me!  You're mine! Lo runs wildly into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me to the desert!  Jen! Come with me to Xin Jiang! The guards surround Lo, but he escapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo leaps and lands right in front of Li Mu Bai, his finge pressed against Lo's neck.  Yu comes running around the corner and sees them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Jade Fox? Yu jumps in and pushes Li away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me!  Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo sits dejectedly, having told his story to Yu and Li, w look him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought she'd give it all up and go back West with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, you are no good to her dead.  With the Gou and Yu clans hunting you, you'll soon be in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you truly loved her, you wouldn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to see her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I'll write you an introduction.  Take it to Wudan. Wait there for news from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu and Li enter, as other men and women race through the compound, a sense of panic in the air.  Yu gives Li a loo Li shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd, including Li and Yu, stand by as Te opens the em sword case, his voice rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will this end?  They take it, they put it back, they take it again.  My home is turning into a warehouse. Bo bursts into the hall, bows to Te.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen has run away!  Gou found the wedding chamber empty.  Governor Yu requests your assistance.  You know the Giang Hu underworld.  He wants to find her, and keep her from harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Te, leave this to us.  Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen arrives at the tea stall.  She places her sword on th table, which catches the attention of a couple of Giang H martial arts characters sitting nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I serve you? As the waitress turns to leave, Jen grabs her by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cup is dirty. The flustered waitress apologizes and takes the cup away. The men approach Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without lifting her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's young Master Long.  My apologies.  I'm Iron Eagle Sung and this is my brother in arms, Flying Cougar Li Yun.  What brings you to Huai An, and where are you headed, Master Long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere there's action. The two men exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, perhaps we could be of assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what if I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have ways of helping you understand. The two pull out their weapons which are immediately chop into scraps by Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you related to Li Mu Bai?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is my defeated foe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li and Yu pass a cup back and forth as Bo tends to the horses in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have some tea. As Yu passes the cup to Li, their fingers touch. Embarrassed, Li pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu Lien... The things we touch have no permanence.  My master would say... there is nothing we can hold on to in this world.  Only by letting go can we truly possess what is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everything is an illusion.  My hand... wasn't that real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hand, rough and callused from machete practice... All this time, I've never had the courage to touch it. Li takes Yu's hand and presses it to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giang Hu is a world of tigers and dragons, full of corruption... I tried sincerely to give it up but I have brought us only trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To repress one's feelings only makes them stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, but I don't know what to do.  I want to be with you... just like this.  It gives me a sense of peace. Li Mu Bai smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen walks upstairs.  A waiter greets her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a clean room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have plenty.  Your order? Jen again sets her sword on the table as she sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steamed whole cod, bite-size meatballs, a little starchy, but keep the sauce light, shark fin soup, mixed vegetables, and some warm wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to order from a bigger restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry then. The waiter gauges Jen for an instant before bouncing off place the orders.  Jen checks her pouch and sees there's much money left. A large group of Giang Hu characters enters.  They survey the restaurant and quickly find Jen upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Iron Arm Mi.  I heard a true master has arrived.  I have come to seek a lesson. Jen ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bristles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for it! Mi charges and attacks Jen, who is still sitting sipping Jen barely lifts a finger and disposes of Mi with a poke a sensitive pressure point.  This provokes a reaction fro the other men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of Iron Arm are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have amazing technique!  I am Flying Machete.  Are you related to Southern Crane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Southern Duck?  I don't eat anything with two feet.  Who could remember such long-winded names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li Mu Bai is your defeated foe, and you don't know his master, Southern Crane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Shining Phoenix Mountain Gou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gou?  I hate that name.  It makes me puke!  Too bad you're named Gou. You'll be the first to feel my sword today. Jen leaps up and dives into battle.  The men all use different kinds of weapons, but they all succumb to the powerful Green Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!  Don't you know Monk Jing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monk, in a place like this?  You need a lesson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? She smiles, and leaps again into action after unsheathing the Green Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I?  I am... I am the Invincible Sword Goddess.  Armed with the Incredible... Green Destiny.  Be you Li or Southern Crane... lower your head... and ask for mercy.  I am the desert dragon. I leave no trace.  Today I fly over Eu-Mei.  Tomorrow... I'll kick over Wudan Mountain! Jen is in a frenzy, slashing and maiming as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu and Li are surrounded by the variously bandaged men wh battled with Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We politely asked for a friendly match, but she showed no respect, and attacked us.  Everyone came by to teach her a lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her sword was just too powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've traveled everywhere, but never met anyone so uncivilized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily bandaged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kept accusing me of being Gou Jun Pei's brother.  Who is this Gou, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband. The men all nod their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li and Yu ride together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're close to your headquarters. Go home and check in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look around and catch up later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea.  Tonight we'll get a good night's sleep at headquarters. Yu takes a fork off the road.  Thunder can be heard in th darkening sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of security men are practicing Kung Fu in the fro yard of Sun Security.  They stop when Yu enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mistress, you're back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you!  How's everything here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  You've been gone a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and I leave again tomorrow. Your wife was due?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a baby girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be happy if she's half as strong as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Wu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the arm?  Still sore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better.  You've been gone so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li Mu Bai is coming to stay the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go and make up his room! Aunt Wu hustles out.  Yu goes into her own room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu lights incense for her former fianc Meng.  Hearing something, she turns to see a dishevelled Jen standing outside downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Shu Lien...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu eases her guard, then opens a drawer, and takes out so clothes.  Jen, wearing just white underclothing, sets herself on the edge of Yu's bed.  Yu brings over the clot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you must be in proper attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just borrowing some clean clothes.  I'm not staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give them to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just passing by and wondered how you were. Jen tries to hide her anxiety but finally breaks down on Yu's shoulder in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the trouble you've caused. Now you know what Giang Hu life is really like.  If you think of me as your sister, let me give you some sisterly advice.  You can run from marriage, but not your parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They forced me to marry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to them first.  Then you can decide about Lo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about Lo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really loves you.  Come back to Peking with me.  We'll find a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li Mu Bai has made arrangements. He sent him to Wudan Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working together to set me up!  I'm leaving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you accuse us?  I always knew you had stolen the sword! I've done nothing but protect you and your family.  And you're repaid me with nothing but contempt.  Li Mu Bai himself spared you, and all you do is insult him.  We wanted some peace and you've ruined it all! You're no sister of mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I care?  You were never a real friend anyway.  But I wonder, how long could you last as my enemy? Jen gets up to leave.  Yu intercepts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the sword down! Jen jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen soars out to the front courtyard where the guards are still practicing. They raise their weapons at the sight of an intruder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen! Jen greets Yu with the Green Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone out.  Shut the doors. The men leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... the friendship is over. Yu scoops up a weapon from one of many lying around and begins her battle with Jen. Yu uses every weapon that's available against Jen but non are any match for the Green Destiny. After slicing through another set of Yu's weapons, Jen lo admiringly at the Green Destiny in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it!  That's Li Mu Bai's sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get it if you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the Green Destiny, you are nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a sore loser.  Go ahead. Take your pick.  I'll wait.  Go ahead. Yu picks up a huge broad sword and attacks.  Just as the Green Destiny slices it in half, Yu holds the broken blad at Jen's neck.  She pauses before hurting Jen, then pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the sword. Jen, taking advantage of Yu's trust, slices her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it! Yu, her shoulder bleeding, falls back as Li Mu Bai jumps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  You don't deserve the Green Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another lecture!  On guard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's end this here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the sword will settle this. Jen soars up to the rooftop, with Li right on her tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen floats over the lake, Li close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen runs into a sea of bamboo.  She appears to have lost but is not slowing down.  Her white clothes are now stain with blood and mud.  The wind had picked up and every bre sounds like an air attack by Li. The two leap onto the tips of the bamboo trees and begin their dances and dodges.  They glance off bamboos and eac other while staying afloat.  Finally Jen lands on the sam stick of bamboo as Li.  The two hold their positions for while, as the bamboo bends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only let you go because I wanted to see the real you. Jen tries to shake Li off the bamboo but Li recovers nice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about a true heart? Li suddenly leaps off the bamboo tree.  The bamboo straightens up and throws Jen toward the ground.  Jen quickly pulls herself up and charges at Li. Jen chases after Li, into a clearing, out of the bamboo forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen finally catches up to Li, who is standing on a rock about a few feet wide amid the rapids.  Jen vaults onto t rock and scuffles with Li.  Jen loses her balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I've always wanted, to teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  If you can take back the sword in three moves, I'll go with you. Li takes the sword back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have no use for the sword. Li throws the sword into the rapids. Jen dives in to retrieve it.  He follows Jen downstream b hopping from one rock to another.  Jen recovers the sword but is herself drowning.  Suddenly Jade Fox swings into t rapids and fishes Jen out.  Jade Fox carries the unconsci Jen away.  Li gives chase, but loses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining.  Inside an old factory, Fox heats some medi paste and then dips a needle in the paste.  She burns the needle point, causing a blue smoke.  She lights some ince and puts it in a burner near Jen, who is barely conscious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later, they'd drag you back to Peking.  Your parents will never accept you again.  But why go home?  We've gone this far, we won't stop now.  You'll always be my lady.  At last, we'll be our own masters.  We'll be happy.  That's the most important thing.  All we have left is each other, right? Lie down and rest. Jen is too weak to respond. Fox leaves Jen clutching the Green Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox scurries ahead in the rain.  Her eyes catch something but she keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Wu finishes bandaging Yu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crazy.  You should have killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Li Mu Bai can do it. Yu senses movement at the window.  Looking out, she sees Jade Fox in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen wakes up, flushed from fever.  She takes a sip from a cup of water -- it's empty.  She tosses the cup, gets up, and walks into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen walks out, raises her face into the rain, and drinks raindrops.  Thirst quenched, she turns around and finds L standing there.  Jen limps towards him while mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it me or the sword you want? Jen falls into Li, who checks her pulse and looks at her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been drugged! Li carries her inside, kicking away the incense burner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li lays his hands on Jen's back; she slowly comes to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Jade Fox? Jen gestures that she doesn't know.  Yu and Bo enter.  Yu looks at Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jade Fox drugged her.  How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We followed Jade Fox. Instantaneously, a flurry of darts flies directly in Jen' direction.  Li and Yu swipe miraculously at them all, sending them flinging hither and thither. Fox shows herself.  Li attacks her.  She falls back, blee to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so you die. Li touches his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so shall you! Li pulls a single needle from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poisoned needle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deserve to die, but the life I was hoping to take... was Jen's. Ten years I devoted to you.  But you deceived me!  You hid the manual's true meaning.  I never improved... but your progress was limitless!  You know what poison is? An eight-year-old girl, full of deceit.  That's poison!  Jen!  My only family... my only enemy... Jade Fox dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
